title: The Vampire Diaries' Nina Dobrev sets Paul Wesley feud rumours straight
text:
Rumours that the pair hated each other swirled around them for years (Picture: Getty)

Whether or not you’re a Vampire Diaries fan, you will probably have heard whispers of a bitter feud between the show’s two principle actors, but Nina Dobrev insists there was never a feud.

The 30-year-old actress, who played Elena Gilbert on the show, cleared up rumours of a feud with Paul Wesley, who played one of her love interests, Stefan Salvatore on Monday’s episode of Chicks in the Office.

Earlier this year it was reported that the pair ‘didn’t get along at the beginning of the show,’ but the actress insisted that was ‘blown out of proportion to such a crazy degree.’

She said: ‘I guess nothing else was happening that week ‘cause every outlet picked it up.’

Joking, she added: ‘I felt like I was Brangelina. You know what, guys? We’re not.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Maybe Nina and Paul aren’t, but Elena and Stefan might be, amiright?

The Fast and Furious eight actress had been ‘talking about all of the wonderful things that I love about Paul Wesley’ at the time and had been referring to only ‘a very brief moment in time [when] we did not get along.’

Nina insists that it was only a little blip in their relationship (Picture: Getty Images)

‘Just like any human wouldn’t,’ she said. ‘If you said that you and your parents have loved each other unconditionally and your siblings from the moment you were born until the day that you die, you’d be a f**king liar.’

Nina insisted that they were ‘best friends’ and any kinks in their relationship was just a part of becoming a family on set.

‘You spend every waking moment together – probably more moments than you do with your real family because you’re there from, like, five in the morning until midnight, six am sometimes,’ she explained.

‘So you see each other with makeup, without makeup, on good days, on bad days, when you’re hungry, when you’re thirsty, when you’re tired. So, there are going to be mood swings.’

Nina went on to say: ‘It was one of those things that we just – it’s not that we didn’t like each other. We just didn’t appreciate each other as much as we do now – and that, of course, got blown [out] of proportion.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They took one sentence out of context and deleted all of the other ones where I’m like, “I love him. We’re best friends now”.’

Nina was part of The Vampire Diaries as a lead from season one to six, and continued to appear on the show’s season seven and eight before it came to a close in March 2017.

Paul on the other hand said they drove each other insane (The CW)

‘It’s bittersweet and nostalgic to think back at, I mean, youth,’ Nina reminisced.

‘It’s a moment in time that we’ll never get back, and I look back at it so fondly – including all of the bad days that Paul Wesley had and that I had. It made us who we are in the best way possible.’

Despite Nina’s best intentions, Paul had a slightly different characterisation of their relationship...

Earlier this year the actor admitted that the pair ‘clashed’ and ‘didn’t get along’ at first.

Paul told Entertainment Tonight: ‘When we first started shooting The Vampire Diaries, we totally clashed. We didn’t [get along].’

He added: ‘Creatively, it just wasn’t in sync.’

The actor went on to say that though they eventually ‘developed love’ for one another, it wasn’t before they drove each other insane.

Advertisement

‘The fans would never have known that. We’re basically driving each other insane and then after a few seasons, we developed this absolute mutual love.’

Hmm…

description: The Vampire Diaries' Nina Dobrev sets Paul Wesley feud rumours straight.
